docs.snippet: " The American nations cannot, must not, and will not permit the establishment of another Communist government in the Western hemisphere."
docs.lead_paragraph: " The American nations cannot, must not, and will not permit the establishment of another Communist government in the Western hemisphere."

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 8 -- The Organization of American States rejected tonight a proposal to vacate the seat of the Dominican Republic at the inter-American body.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 8 -- The Organization of American States rejected tonight a proposal to vacate the seat of the Dominican Republic at the inter-American body.
docs.abstract: OAS rejects proposal to vacate Dominican seat, make Amb Bonilla and rebel repr observers

headline.main: O.A.S. BARS VACATING THE DOMINICAN SEAT

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 10 -- A ministerial meeting of the Organization of American States voted this evening to give a five-man truce committee immediate responsibility for conditions in the Dominican Republic.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 10 -- A ministerial meeting of the Organization of American States voted this evening to give a five-man truce committee immediate responsibility for conditions in the Dominican Republic.
docs.abstract: OAS, 14-3, votes extension of peace com mandate to help restore govt machinery and lay basis for elections; com will be pol counterpart of mil force; OAS, 15-5, defeats Mex resolution for immediate US withdrawal; Caamano Govt protests Bonilla status as OAS repr; threatens to boycott OAS peace talks; demands OAS recognize Dr A Rosario as repr; 10 nations reptdly will contribute to force; US affirms refusal to recognize Caamano Govt

headline.main: O.A.S. TRUCE UNIT GETS NEW POWER; Mission, in 14-3 Vote, Told to Assume Responsibility in Dominican Crisis O.A.S. TRUCE BODY GETS NEW POWERS

byline.original: By JOHN W. FINNEYSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MEXICO CITY, May 10 -- The United States' position in the Dominican Republic continued to come under attack here today at the 11th conference of the Economic Commission for Latin America.
docs.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY, May 10 -- The United States' position in the Dominican Republic continued to come under attack here today at the 11th conference of the Economic Commission for Latin America.
docs.abstract: Uruguay, USSR and Cuba score US policy, ECLA conf, Mex City

headline.main: U.S. ATTACKED ANEW AT TALKS IN MEXICO

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 11 -- The United States opposed a Uruguayan resolution today that would give the Secretary General a vague authorization to intervene in the Dominican situation.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 11 -- The United States opposed a Uruguayan resolution today that would give the Secretary General a vague authorization to intervene in the Dominican situation.
docs.abstract: Stevenson charges plan seeks to interpose Council just when OAS is dealing with situation

headline.main: U.S. Opposes Proposal for Thant To Report on Dominican Dispute

byline.original: Speclal to The New York Tims

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 14 -- Responding today to an "urgent" appeal from the Dominican rebels, the Security Council asked the Secretary General, U Thant, to send a representative to report on the situation in Santo Domingo.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 14 -- Responding today to an "urgent" appeal from the Dominican rebels, the Security Council asked the Secretary General, U Thant, to send a representative to report on the situation in Santo Domingo.
docs.abstract: UN Security Council asks Thant to send UN repr to scene, in response to rebel plea; US joins unanimous vote; rebels charge OAS is unable to act or oppose US wishes; urge Thant stop advance of US troops; Thant agrees to send advance mission under Maj Gen Rikhye but notes difficulties in carrying out Council mandate; Stevenson denies specific rebel charges of mil advance; says US could not prevent junta air attack

headline.main: U.N. SENDS MISSION TO SANTO DOMINGO ON REBELS' PLEA; Security Council Responds With U.S. Assent -- Junta Again Attacks Radio U.N. SENDS MISSION TO SANTO DOMINGO

byline.original: By THOMAS J. HAMILTONSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: A largely technical recovery erased a 4-cent drop in old-crop soybean futures prices yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade. The near months closed with slight gains, while the distant soybean deliveries fell along with wheat and oats.
docs.lead_paragraph: A largely technical recovery erased a 4-cent drop in old-crop soybean futures prices yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade. The near months closed with slight gains, while the distant soybean deliveries fell along with wheat and oats.

headline.main: Commodities: Prices for Old-Crop Soybeans Register Advance on Chicago Board; WHEAT FUTURES SHOW A DECLINE

docs.snippet: CARACAS, Venezuela, May 19 -- The Dominican crisis is deepening the cleavage in Latin America over how to deal with Communist subversion in the Western. Hemisphere.
docs.lead_paragraph: CARACAS, Venezuela, May 19 -- The Dominican crisis is deepening the cleavage in Latin America over how to deal with Communist subversion in the Western. Hemisphere.

headline.main: Latins and Red Issue; Military and Civilian Governments Differ on How to Handle Subversion

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: AMERICAN NATIONS AND WESTERN HEMISPHERE POSSESSIONS

byline.original: By JUAN de ONISSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: THE Secretary General of the Organization of American States, selected by that body Thursday to work out a cease-fire in the Dominican Republic, has a stock phrase that illustrates his philosophy in a crisis.
